User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build ID: 20110319135224

Steps to reproduce:

1. created a test case
2. created a test plan
3. created a test run
4. marked the test case as PASSED and stopped the test run
5. modified the "Action/Expected Results" text
6. now I am looking at the Case Run History and cannot see how I can see what the "Action/Expected Results" text was when the test case was run


Actual results:

I found a way to browse any version of the "Action/Expected Results" text but I see no link to the "Action/Expected Results" version in the Case Run History table.

I can see when the test run was closed but the "Action/Expected Results" versions do not appear to be timestamped.


Expected results:

I think the Case Run History table should have a column called "test revision". It'd also be nice to be able to see when the test revisions actually occurred.

comments.text: Since Testopia is designed to record what exactly was tested the issue looks critical. A workaround could be to keep test case definitions in an external version control system and specify the revision number in the test case summary.
